snippet: The de facto coalition of militias, the United States and the Iraqi government against the Islamic State shows little promise for stability.
abstract: Power and autonomy of Asaib Ahl al-Haq and other Shiite militias in fight to defeat Islamic State in Iraq and Syria pose central challenge to creation of a more just and less sectarian Iraqi government; while many Iraqi Shiites view militias as their protectors, many in Sunni minority say they fear groups as agents of Iran, empowered by Iraqi government to kill with impunity.
lead_paragraph: The de facto coalition of militias, the United States and the Iraqi government against the Islamic State shows little promise for stability.

headline.main: Shiite Militias Pose Challenge for U.S. in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Shiite Militias Pose Challenge for U.S. in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
